data.title: How to Score NDP Tickets + Best Spots to Watch the 2024 NDP Fireworks in Singapore for FREE!
data.meta_description: Here's where to go for free stellar views of the NDP 2024 Fireworks in Singapore from central spots to the heartlands fireworks.
data.text:
Everything you need to know about NDP 2024, including scoring tickets plus where to go for stellar views of the NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore. This year there will be fireworks at The Padang, Marina Bay and five other heartland locations across Singapore!

Looking forward to the 2024 NDP fireworks in Singapore? This year’s celebration promises to be a big one, extending beyond 9 August 2024. With NDP festivities taking place at two venues this year, The Padang and The Promontory at Marina Bay, you can expect some of the largest fireworks displays NDP has ever offered! There may also be fireworks displays at the two NDP rehearsal shows this year. Additionally, heartland NDP celebrations featuring fireworks will be held across the island, ensuring you can enjoy the stunning displays near you.

– All you need to know about National Day Parade 2024

Getting NDP 2024 tickets

Balloting for the National Day Parade 2024 tickets is now closed. Successful applicants will receive email notifications between 21 – 25 June 2024. If you’re unable to secure NDP tickets, fret not! You can try your luck to win tickets to NDP 2024 by joining the different contests on social media. The campaign aims to encourage community building during the NDP period. From hanging the Singapore flag outside your home, to enjoying a meal with your family at the hawker centre or even dancing to the NDP 2024 theme song, you can stand to win tickets, NDP 2024 memorabilia and more! More information here.

Guide to NDP 2024

This year’s NDP fireworks display will be the biggest yet, with celebrations taking place at both Marina Bay and The Padang. National Day fireworks will be coordinated across these venues, providing a 360-degree experience! Additionally, on 10 August 2024, stunning fireworks will light up five heartland locations throughout Singapore. While details are still pending, previous celebrations have been evenly distributed across different regions, ensuring there’s an NDP celebration near you!

The NDP parade this year promises never-before-seen displays and demonstrations, aligned with the theme “Together, As One United People.” It marks the first National Day for Prime Minister Lawrence Wong and President Tharman Shanmugaratnam in their new roles. For the first time, the parade will feature the Total Defence 40 (TD40) Dynamic Defence Display. Attendees will witness a war-fighting demonstration between the Padang and Marina Bay, showcasing integrated Whole-of-Government and community responses to potential threats, including air and maritime threats, civil emergencies, and more.

When will the NDP fireworks in Singapore take place?

The official NDP fireworks display takes place on 9 August 2024. On 10 August 2024, you can view fireworks across five heartland locations.

In addition, there are usually preview NDP shows: NDP Preview 1 (27 July 2024), NDP Preview 2 (3 August 2024).

What time are the NDP 2024 fireworks?

Based on the previous years, the NDP fireworks timing usually occur between 8.10pm and 8.30pm on the day itself. Stay tuned for more details about the fireworks displays in the heartlands!

Where to watch NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore for free!

Pack a picnic, wear comfy clothes and head to these vantage points – you just might be lucky and catch a FREE view of the NDP 2024 fireworks!

Read more: Best Rooftop Dining Restaurants

1. The Helix

A popular pedestrian bridge that connects Marina Centre to Marina South, the Helix (a.k.a the Helix Bridge or Double Helix) is one of the best vantage spots to watch the NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore for free! This Insta-worthy bridge is beautifully lit up in the evenings, too, so it’s always worth a trip just for the ‘gram.

Where: Marina Bay, bridge linking Marina Bay and Marina Centre, Singapore 038981

Access via: Bayfront or Promenade MRT stations

2. Marina Barrage

This reservoir is one of the most popular locations for brilliant views of the 2024 National Day fireworks display across the Bay. We highly suggest packing snacks and your kites, so you snag a good spot in advance. Have a ball with the kids on the lovely windy green before settling down to watch the NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore light up the sky over the Singapore Flyer, Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands.

Where: 8 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018951

Access via: Marina Bay MRT station, then SBS bus number 400 from Marina Bay Financial Centre. Car Parking at Gardens By the Bay.

3. Gardens by the Bay

Head to the waterfront promenade at Bay East Garden – it connects to East Coast Park via the Barrage and there are loads of great spots for stunning views of fireworks in Singapore along its 2km stretch. Best of all, the garden is open 24 hours and admission is free, so you can sit back and watch the 2024 National Day fireworks spectacle with the fam.

Where: 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953

Access via: Bayfront MRT Station and follow the underground linkway. Expect crowds in the MRT (grab a rentable cycle to avoid the masses). Car Parking at Gardens By the Bay.

4. Mount Faber Peak

Home to the Singapore cable car attraction, Mount Faber Peak is popular with families looking for a gorgeous hike or walk among the greenery. Want to eat dinner while watching the NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore? Head to Arbora Hilltop Garden Bistro for a mix of Western classics and kid-friendly options with stupendous views of the Singapore skyline.

Where: 109 Mount Faber Road, Singapore 099203

Access via: Harbourfront MRT and then take a 12-15 minute walk up

5. Marina Bay Sands Promontory, Merlion Park

Accessed by a short walk across the Jubilee Bridge, Merlion Park is where you’ll find all the best fireworks action. The crowds flock here each year, so come early to get a prime seat to watch the 2024 NDP fireworks in Singapore.

Where: One Fullerton, near the Central Business District

Access via: MRT from Raffles Place Park at One Fullerton

6. Waterfront Promenade, Esplanade

A free view of the NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore and must-see views of Singapore’s skyline? This breezy spot is where it’s all at. There are restaurants all around the area, so come early for a bite with the kiddies before parking yourself on the steps for prime views of the fireworks display.

Where: 1 Esplanade Drive, Singapore 038981

Access via: City Hall or Esplanade MRT stations

7. The Lawn @ Marina Bay

If there’s a number one stop to watch the NDP fireworks in Singapore then this is it. It’s just a patch of grass in the heart of the CBD, but it’s laidback and has good views of the fireworks.

Where: 11 Marina Boulevard, Singapore 018940

Access via: Downtown MRT Station

8. Singapore flyer

Catching the NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore from the Singapore Flyer will give you the best bird’s eye view, and because it’s the hottest seat in the nation, the tickets get sold out quickly! It’s a bit of a cheat entry into best ‘free’ spots to watch the 2024 fireworks since you still have to buy a ticket to the flyer.

Where: 30 Raffles Ave., Singapore 039803

Access via: Promenade MRT Station

9. Highhouse

Highhouse is located high up at Level 61 and 62 of One Raffles Place, offering stunning views of the Singapore skyline, making it one of the best spots to catch the 2024 NDP fireworks. Remember to book a table near the window to catch the best view!

Where: 1 Raffles Place, Singapore 048616

Access via: 2-minute walk from Raffles Place MRT

10. High Street Centre Carpark

You might think it’s strange to head to a carpark for NDP fireworks, but if you want to avoid the usually crowded places, then this is the place to go! The 5th floor of the carpark overlooks the Singapore River with a gorgeous view of the city skyline and the Marina Bay area, which is where you’ll see the fireworks!

Where: 1 North Bridge Road, Singapore 179094

Access via: 6-minute walk from Clarke Quay and City Hall MRT stations

11. Marina Barrage

You won’t get a full view of the fireworks here, but we love the green space on the rooftop of Marina Barrage that overlooks the city skyline. You can see the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, and a glimpse of the Esplanade, plus get a peek of the NDP fireworks. Pack a picnic and get comfy under the starry night!

Where: 8 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018951

Access via: Gardens by the Bay MRT station, Exit 2

12. Marina South Pier

Located along Marina Coastal Drive, Marina South Pier is tucked further away from the prime location for the NDP fireworks, but you’ll probably still be able to see the fireworks. If you have younger kids who might be afraid of very loud noises, then this might be a great place to catch the NDP fireworks without busting your eardrums!

Where: 31 Marina Coastal Drive, Singapore 018988

Access via: Marina South Pier MRT, Exit B

13. Marina Square Rooftop

Okay, you might not get the best views from this spot. But since it overlooks part of the Singapore cityscape including Marina Bay Sands, you should be able to catch a glimpse of the NDP fireworks. Since it’s located on the rooftop of a popular mall downtown, it might get crowded. So, be sure to get there early to save the best spot to see the NDP fireworks!

Where: Rooftop of Marina Square, 6 Raffles Blvd, Singapore 039594

Access via: top floor of the Marina Square Mall, 4-min walk from Esplanade MRT station via Exit C

14. Victoria Theatre

Victoria Theatre and Victoria Concert Hall is a beautiful venue in itself. Although it offers a partially blocked view of the 2024 National Day fireworks, this venue is bound to see large crowds gather every year. Be sure to get there early to secure a good spot!

Where: 11 Empress Pl, #01-02, Singapore 179558

Access via: 3-minute walk from City Hall MRT and Raffles Place MRT

NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore’s heartlands

While details are still limited for now, heartlanders in the know usually flock to spots like Jurong West Stadium, Bedok Stadium, Toa Payoh Stadium, Woodlands Stadium, Our Tampines Hub, Punggol, and more to catch the heartlands National Day fireworks display.

We’re on the lookout for more information on other heartlands fireworks for NDP so stay tuned.

Restaurants/hotels with views of NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore

Want birds-eye views of the National Day fireworks in Singapore? Then why not book a weekend staycation – some hotels have NDP staycation packages – or watch the fireworks over a nice dinner at one of the island’s best rooftop restaurants? Here are some restaurants and hotels with the best views of the NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore (but you should always call to check if your table/room will have a view of the fireworks to avoid disappointment):

– Pullman Singapore Hill Street

– JW Marriott Singapore South Beach

– CE LA VI, Marina Bay Sands

– LAVO, Marina Bay Sands

– LeVeL 33, Marina Bay Financial Centre

– VUE

– ART Restaurant

– Marina Bay Sands Singapore

– PARKROYAL Collection Marina Bay

– The Fullerton Bay Hotel

– The Ritz-Carlton, Millenia Singapore

– Fairmont Singapore

– Marina Mandarin

– Pan Pacific Singapore

– Mandarin Oriental, Singapore

– Singapore Flyer

– Peninsula Excelsior Hotel

– Swissotel The Stamford

Sassy Mama Tip: One thing to consider if you are checking out all the best locations for NDP 2024 fireworks in Singapore is not just the view of the fireworks, it’s how (and when) you are going to get back home, especially if you are up late with kiddos, as these spots get very busy and catching a taxi may be difficult!
